properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:00 CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is located near Delta Beach along the southern shore of Lake Manitoba and is moving to the eastnortheast at 50 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-17T19:26:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T17:00:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0498254478.2020
Area: R.M. of Portage la Prairie incl. St. Ambroise
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots this afternoon and early this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 40 are expected for the next 4 days. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-17T18:38:12-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain this afternoon and early this evening. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-18T02:59:31-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 38 are expected for the next 2 days. A hot and humid air mass will affect the area today and Saturday. Slightly cooler and less humid air will arrive on Sunday. Daytime high temperatures: Near 29 degrees Celsius Overnight low temperatures: Near 18 degrees Celsius Humidex values: 34 Friday increasing to 37 Saturday Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-18T07:21:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T15:22:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3377379828.2020
Area: Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: zero to +2 (coolest in low lying areas). Locations: most of central, northeastern, and eastern Newfoundland. Time span: early Saturday morning. Remarks: Patchy frost is expected to form as clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures, especially in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-18T05:18:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T13:19:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0430086628.2020
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail. A low pressure system approaching from SK will allow convective initiation over the Manitoba lakes this afternoon, and these storms will have the risk of strong gusts and damaging hail. This squall watch may be extended as the situation develops. Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall watch. Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-18T00:28:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T16:30:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1310869049.2020
Area: Lake Winnipegosis, Lake Winnipeg - north basin, Lake Manitoba
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A low pressure trough pushing into western Manitoba today combined with a warm and humid airmass will trigger thunderstorms this afternoon and evening, some of which have the potential to become severe. The thunderstorms will push into the Red River Valley by late afternoon and southeastern regions this evening, so watches may have to be extended eastward later today. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-18T06:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T16:04:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0698328065.2020

These thunderstorms stretch from near Amaranth to Macdonald and are moving northeast at 55 km/h. ### Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and increasingly humid air mass will begin to affect Toronto today and last through at least Monday. Slightly cooler and less humid conditions may arrive on Tuesday. Daytime high temperatures: 31 to 34 degrees Celsius Overnight low temperatures: 20 to 24 degrees Celsius Humidex values: 38 to 42 Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-18T06:50:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T14:51:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3924412389.2020

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Intermittent, strong easterly wind gusts near 100 km/h will continue today and may continue into this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Dense fog with visibilities of 400 metres or less persists at Coral Harbour, Naujaat, Igloolik and Hall Beach due to a moist southeasterly flow off Hudson Bay and Foxe Basin. Similar conditions will continue today and tonight, then gradually start to improve on Saturday as winds become lighter and shift more northerly. ### Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-18T07:54:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-17T15:55:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2924097877.2020
Area: Naujaat, Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada
